data.title: Best Thai meal I've had by far
data.text:
Absolutely superb meal and wonderful service.  I only wandered in while on the lookout for somewhere to grab lunch and am so glad I did ... wonderful flavours, very generous portions of the highest quality ingredients, unbeatable prices and service to make you smile

I'm only sad that I'm unlikely to revisit the general area as I'll probably never find such an excellent Thai restaurant again

data.title: Great Thai Cuisine
data.text:
A great little restaurant. 
It was clean with friendly attentive staff.
The meals were of a very good standard with fresh ingredients, with the added bonus of not being expensive.
A recommended restaurant.

data.title: Excellent Thai food
data.text: Stopped here to grab something  to eat before the Jackson Brown concert at Mesa Arts Center. I even got a free $5 off coupon for downtown merchants  including Nunthaporns, when I parked at the public parking next to the MAC. I ordered the pad thai with vermicelli noodles (woon sen pad thai) which was excellent, and my friends ordered regular pad thai and tofu curry and they enjoyed those dishes. Chicken in the pad thai was moist and tasty. Prices are good with most entrees at $10 and generous portion sizes. Beer and wine selection is limited but what else are you going to drink other than Singha at a Thai place? The restaurant was a very pleasant surprise and I plan on going back next time I go to the MAC.

data.title: First time
data.text: This was my first experience with this type of cuisine...I loved it. I would having given it a 5 rating but as this was my first time I had no base line on which to compare it.  If you try this restaurant try the Thai tea... fantastic and delicious!

data.title: Best Thai food anywhere
data.text: Every winter we look forward tI eating here as it is the best Thai food.  The food is fresh and hot.  Make a reservation so you are not dissipointed.

data.title: standard thai like we need
data.text: Sometimes you just want a place you can go that is not too challenging and is affordable.  This is a nice place.  Clean, friendly, food not too challenging but good tasting and a good value.  The menu has the standard curries and thai dishes, the heat is made to your liking.  There appeared to be some regulars who know the place well and the contributed to a pleasant atmosphere.  You could come here with a family, for a date or dinner with a friend.  Good place.

data.title: Excelent Lunch Special
data.text: We had a lunch here, that was delicious and ridiculously cheap. I had the yellow curry with jazmin rice. Included the soup. All for $8. Wow. Wish I have something like this back home.

data.title: Exceptional Thai Cooking in Downtown Mesa
data.text: Having been to a concert at the Mesa Arts Center (a wonderful place), Victoria and I were intrigued with downtown Mesa and went exploring a few days later. We found Nunthaporn's Thai Restaurant by chance and decided to give it a try. What a find. We sat outside and ate Pad Thai with pork for $8 a dish along with excellent soup and an egg roll. Everything was delicious. I had a sweet iced coffee that was just perfect. Service was great, parking is available on the street and at the arts center nearby. This is a little gem you shouldn't pass up in downtown Mesa, Az.

data.title: Great food, cook came out to talk to one in our party about her dietary needs...
data.text:
Food was great. I'd go back in a heartbeat. I got to taste all three of the plates ordered and would have any one of those dishes again. The Place is convenient to the Mesa Art Center, just down the street. We had a nice meal then walked to our show. The Cashew (Pad Med-Ma-Muang) was AMAZING!

Servers were overattentive, hence no 5 star rating, and kept interrupting our group. They didn't seem to be assigned to any particular tables so each one asked us multiple times if we were OK. Maybe this review will fix that problem ;)

data.title: Great for Take Out!
data.text: While visiting in Mesa, our friends stopped at Nunthaporn's to pick up take out before coming to our home for dinner. The four of us agreed that this was some of the best Thai food we ever had. I recommended the restaurant based on local reviews and we weren't disappointed. The food arrived hot and in ample portions and we finished it off without a problem. In the mood for Thai? We will return for more.

data.title: Great gem in downtown Mesa
data.text: Our family discovered this place a couple years ago and it quickly become our favorite Thai restaurant. Their food is so flavorful! We love the green curry but we haven't tried a curry dish we didn't like. Our kids love the Pad-see-ew and Pad-woon-sen. Seriously delicious, flavorful and just enough spice to keep the adults and kids happy. This is a great place to come with couples as well. If it was closer to home we would come every week. We never get tired of it. If you are in the area it's worth a stop and it's right on Main Street so you could ride the light rail from Phoenix.

data.title: Great Thai food
data.text:
My wife and I love this place.  It is usually busy but we have never had to wait for seating.  The food is amazing.  We both like it a little on the spicey side.  Whatever we order, they make it perfect every time.  They have a nice selection of wine to eat with your meal.  The portions are large.
We have tried 6 other Thai restaurants in Mesa and we always come back to this one.  It is the best in Mesa, AZ.

data.title: Amazing foods
data.text: I am a very picky Asian when it comes to Asian food. I am usually not generous with my rating for Asian quality foods and service, but I have to give Nunthaporn a rating of 5 for their good food and friendly service. There is not that many good Thai restaurants in Phoenix Metropolitan area. One day, I tumbled into this mom and pop restaurant in downtown Mesa and have been going since 2010. The food is amazing. Their lunch portions are generous and the egg rolls are good. Okay, I am picky with egg rolls too because I do know how to make egg rolls The chef, kitchen staff and servers are friendly. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to try.

data.title: Mixed
data.text: We ordered two dishes, one was absolutely amazing, the other extremely bland and boring. We fought over the good noodle dish.

data.title: Good Thai Lunch
data.text: We stopped in for lunch.  We got some curries and other dishes.  Everyone liked their choice and this was a group that is discriminating with their thai food.  I would definitely go again.

data.title: Best Thai around
data.text: Wonderful dining experience, great staff and owners - extremely dignified and wonderful food - a great dining experience

data.title: Great thai
data.text: Fresh and tasty.  The lunch menu is very good and offers many choices. The Service was  great. I had the Pad Thai and it was delicious. I enjoyed the fresh ingredients. It is on the light rail in a charming area. The arts center is nearby. It seems to be in a very active area.

data.title: Hard to Pronounce, but EASY to Enjoy!
data.text: When the family is in the mood for thai, this is a must!  Fabulous soups and entrees!  Our favorite is the lemongrass soup (tom yum)!  My personal favorite for lunch is the Evil Jungle Princess or Yellow Curry.  If you plan on getting dinner before a show at the Mesa Arts Center, give yourself PLENTY of time, though!

data.title: Excellent curry dishes
data.text: Visiting Phoenix from Illinois to see family.  Went here because my wife's brother likes it.  After eating here I know why he likes it.  I had masaman curry with chicken and jasmine rice.  It came out very fresh, aromatic, well seasoned but not excessively hot/spicy.  Just right to my taste.  Some in our party were vegetarian:  the no-meat curries were excellent too.  My wife's brother got a yellow curry with soft tofu.  I tasted it and liked it.  Another plus is they serve both white rice and brown rice.  Only a couple of things keep me from giving it 5 stars:  Decor here is very simple and plain and a bit shop-worn.  Server was new to this restaurant  but still was attentive, polite, and enthusiastic.  Would definitely go here again.

data.title: Yum Thai
data.text: Low key establishment. Good food, dependable service. Great flavors to all the dishes we ordered. Always have a good experience.
